text.text_translated: The first plan is a test called DART (Double Asteroid Redirection Test). Scientists will test DART on the moon of an asteroid called Didymos. The moon's name is 'Didymoon' and it is 150 metres wide. It moves in an orbit around the bigger 800-metre asteroid. DART will hit Didymoon. Scientists hope the hit will change its path enough for telescopes on Earth to see. An orbit is a path in space where a small thing moves around a big thing.
